intro: Placolobium hoaense, commonly known as the Hoaense Placolobium, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of the island. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth surface and a glossy appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
